body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t3TS-8Q8Mlw&feature=youtu.be


Broke the old WR by 3.8M

If it cleared this run wouldve gotten around 28-29M but games are too hard

title: I have achieved a World Record in Touhou

Guess my time on my pc paid off? :^)

replies.body:
wow, great =o
wait, in what? O_o
P.S. there is a mistake in video name: your score is 24.418.640, not 24.481.640
replies.body_tagged:
wow, great =o
wait, in what? O_o
P.S. there is a mistake in video name: your score is 24.418.640, not 24.481.640

replies.body: Actually, a lot of people play Touhou, and to achieve a world record takes a lot of skill. It's the same in any game, sport or video. It takes a lot of practice to get to that level and imo the determination it takes to get there merits some respect.

replies.body:
Determination to beat a video game. 

Are you listening to yourself right now?

Nice job though Glitchy, it is a world record.

Determination to beat a video game.

replies.body:
Thank you, but I didnt actually beat the game, I game overed at stage 4 yet still beat the old world record because of the strategies I used.

But yeah it seems silly to say "Determination to beat a video game" but the feeling of accomplishing something like this is very nice. Like getting a really good grade on a test or something

replies.body: Yeah, I don't see a flaw in that. Take a look at LoL (League of Legends) or even MC, to get really good it takes a fair amount of work, and it feels good being able to say you put that effort in and you accomplished something.
